title: (x) Stone Canyon stone carved lettering - similar to ITC Berkeley Oldstyle, Californian {Marc O}
content:
I know I’ve seen it before, just can’t remember what it is.

[http://www.gobeyondmarketing.com/images/stonecanyon.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/www.gobeyondmarketing.com/images/stonecanyon.jpg "http://www.gobeyondmarketing.com/images/stonecanyon.jpg")

Trying to work up a new logo and they want to use the same font.

 [‹ (x) Italic 2005 with ball-less 2 - ITC Slimbach {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/typophile.com/node/33588 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) The Village at Colony Place logo - Bernhard Modern, Bodoni {Ken Messenger, Lex} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/typophile.com/node/33583 "Go to next forum topic")
author: MrBaseball34

comments.content:
That’s not a font – it’s stone carving

Nick Cooke
What exactly do you like about this kind of lettering? Maybe we can come up with something similar that you might like.

[quote]That’s not a font – it’s stone carving[/quote]  
DUH!!! Brilliant observation, Sherlock.

It is also a font. Their letterhead and logo, etc, all have this font  
used.

This feels Goudy-esque to me. It’s similar to ITC Berkeley or Font Bureau’s Californian.

[http://fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc\_berkeley\_old\_style\_std/](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc_berkeley_old_style_std/ "http://fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/itc\_berkeley\_old\_style\_std/")

[http://fontshop.com/search/?q=CALIFORNIAN&x=0&y=0](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/fontshop.com/search/?q=CALIFORNIAN&x=0&y=0 "http://fontshop.com/search/?q=CALIFORNIAN&x=0&y=0")

Thanks, marcox. I actually have the Californian. Wow, didn’t see the silmilarities.

Have a good weeked.

You wouldn’t happen to know a free alternative to URW Agenda Ex Bold?

URW Agenda seems inspired, to put it kindly, by Clearface Gothic (itself available from several foundries).

[http://fontshop.com/search/?q=clearface+gothic&site=d&btnG=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20070908122143/http:/fontshop.com/search/?q=clearface+gothic&site=d&btnG=Go "http://fontshop.com/search/?q=clearface+gothic&site=d&btnG=Go")

Seems unlikely that there’ll be a free alternative.

\>\> _That’s not a font – it’s stone carving._

\> _DUH!!! Brilliant observation, Sherlock._

What Nick meant is that often letters carved in stone — and specifically this example — are not based on fonts that are available digitally. This is custom lettering, not type.

[quote]This is custom lettering, not type.[/quote]  
I beg to differ, it may be a modified version of the fonts  
identified but it was still a font before being LASER CARVED into  
the stone. I have tocuhed the sign, myself, and it was not hand  
carved, hence it had to be done by a computer, and thus digital fonts HAD to be used.

This is closed because I used Californian as it was extremely close, so, close that you can’t tell unless it’s blown up so large...  
I redid the logo in Illustrator and it looks great.
